comment: Superhero movies aren't about representation. They're about individual characters, not group ideologies. They're about family feuds, cosmic chess games, projectiles and pyrotechnics that can level entire city blocks or reduce planets to asteroids. You want Asian representation, there's a Shang Chi movie coming out in July despite it never being a priority title even as a comic. We could have had a Sleepwalker movie, a great mythology wrapped in a hard to find or underrated comic book. But because of a fictitious need for 'representation', we get Shang Chi ahead of Morbius, Infinity Watch, Darkhawk, Sleepwalker, The Eternals, etc. I don't watch movies for representation and neither does anyone else. We watch movies because we need our Campbellian Hero's Journey fix.
author: Hatchet Mouth

Still it's just a rumor and who knows if it's just an attention grabbing move from a scooper.
